intro: Boechera oxylobula, commonly known as the mountain rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Boechera oxylobula is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
